titlepage.titleproper: Preliminary Inventory to the John Hiestand Collection, 1942-1945
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Letters, conference proceedings, transcripts of radio broadcasts, propaganda leaflets, and printed matter, relating primarily to the work of the United States Office of War Information and the United States Army Psychological Warfare Branch in the Southwest Pacific, 1944-1945.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], John Hiestand Collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

controlaccess.head: Access Points
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army. Forces, Pacific. Psychological Warfare Branch.
United States. Office of War Information.
controlaccess.subject: Propaganda, American.
World War, 1939-1945.
World War, 1939-1945--Propaganda.
World War, 1939-1945--Psychological aspects.

did.unittitle: Letter of appreciation from Brigadier General Bonner F. Fellers to Elmer Davis, Director of the Office of War Information (OWI), November 1, 1944
Letter from Earl M. Thacker to friends, relating his account of military rule in Hawaii Nei, April 7, 1942
Proceedings of the Conference of OWI Chiefs of Outposts in the Pacific Area, May 24-27, 1945, Monterey, California
Transcripts of broadcasts of "The Philippine Hour," an OWI radio program in the Philipplines, October 1944 - May 1945
Special editions of the Free Philippines, August 14 and September 3, 1945
Souvenirs: pencil, " `I shall return' --MacArthur"; match box, "I shall return"
Oversize Scrapbook of propaganda leaflets released in the Southwest Pacific by the Psychological Warfare Branch, U.S. Army, Pacific Area,
"Manchoukuo, An Epic," a picture book, n.p., n.d.,
